page.title: 18A BETTER VILLAGE--S.LEDIS
page.content: I THINK THE WEST HALLAM AREA NEEDS TO BE IMPROVED IN MANY WAYS.ONE THING WE PARTICULARLY NEED IS A SECONDARY SCHOOL.WHY? BECAUSE OF THE AMOUNT OF NEW HOUSES BEING BUILT.ABOUT 4 OUT OF 5 HOUSES HAVE CHILDREN WHO WILL COME TO SCARGILL SCHOOL.WHEN THE 4TH YEAR CHILDREN LEAVE THEY WILL HAVE TO GO A LONG WAY ON THE BUS TO ILKESTON. A HOSPITAL IS ANOTHER THING NEEDED THING;SO THAT WHEN SOMEONE GETS HURT THEY DON'T HAVE TO TRAVEL TOO FAR TO GET TO A HOSPITAL.IT WOULD BE A LOT EASIER TO HAVE ONE NEAR US. ROADS NEED TO BE RESURFACED, ESPECIALLY STATION ROAD.POT-HOLES CAN RUIN TYRES.THEY NEED TO BE FILLED IN. THE SCHOOL IS HAVING CHANGES.THE LIBRARY HAS BEEN MOVED AND BOYS AND GIRLS SHOWERS ARE BEING INSTALLED.
